Type.Name: TextWriter

TypeSignature.Value: .class public abstract serializable TextWriter extends System.MarshalByRefObject implements System.IDisposable
public abstract class TextWriter : MarshalByRefObject, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit TextWriter extends System.MarshalByRefObject implements class System.IDisposable

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents a writer that can write a sequential series of characters.

remarks.para:
is designed for character output, whereas the
class is designed for byte input and output.

para.block: By default, a is not thread safe. See for a thread-safe wrapper.

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.para: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.para: When the parameter is , this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

para.block: can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding (), be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed in an earlier call to .

summary.para: Gets the in which the output is written.

value.para: The in which the output is written.

para.block: This property is required in some XML scenarios where a header must be written containing the encoding used by the . This allows XML code to consume an arbitrary and generate a correct XML header.

summary.para: Gets or sets the line terminator string used by the current .

value.para: A containing the line terminator string for the current .

remarks.para: The default line terminator string is .

The line terminator string is written to the text stream whenever one of the methods is called. In order for text written by the to be readable by a , only should be used as a terminator string. If is set to , the default newline character is used instead.

summary.para: Provides a object without a backing store.

remarks.para: Use to redirect output to a stream that will not consume any operating system resources.
When a method is invoked on , the call simply returns, and no data is actually written to any backing store.

summary.para: Writes out the format string to the text stream.

remarks.para: This version of is equivalent to ( (, )).

block.para: If the specified object is not referenced in the format string, it is ignored.
This method does not search the specified for individual newline characters (hexadecimal 0x000a) and replace them with .

exception.para: The format specification in is invalid.
The number indicating an argument to be formatted is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the number of provided objects to be formatted (1).
